main_definition: Planned or arranged to occur at a specific time or date.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Related to an event or task that has been set for a particular day and time in advance.
meanings_and_examples.example: The meeting is scheduled for 3 PM tomorrow.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to something, like medication or maintenance work, being planned at regular intervals.
meanings_and_examples.example: My doctor has scheduled my flu vaccine every year on October 1st.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Describes a transport service that is pre-arranged and operates according to an established timetable.
meanings_and_examples.example: I have a train ticket, so I'm scheduled to arrive in New York at noon tomorrow.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used informally when something has been planned or organized but not necessarily fixed to the same degree as before.
meanings_and_examples.example: Since we couldn't make it on Saturday, let's see if we can schedule a new time for our get-together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates something that has been designated or allotted within an organizational structure or system.
meanings_and_examples.example: Our project workload is scheduled among the different teams according to their specialization areas.
